City Council
============

* City Council


The Converse City Council is comprised of seven members, a Mayor, and six council members. They all serve at-large, which means all seven members represent the entire city. They are elected to two-year terms. The City of Converse holds elections every year in November. If the election year ends in an odd number, the positions that are up for election are:
Mayor, Place 1, Place 3,  and Place 5
If the election year ends in an even number, the positions that are up for election are:
Place 2, Place 3, and Place 4
For more information on elections, click
[City Secretary](https://www.conversetx.net/city_services/city_secretary.php#collapse592b0)
Meetings

* First and third Tuesdays of each month
* City of Converse City Council Chambers (402 S. Seguin Rd., Converse, TX 78109)

An agenda for each upcoming council meeting is posted at least 3 business days in advance on the bulletin board located in front of City Hall (406 S. Seguin Rd.). All council meetings are open to the public. We welcome your participation!

[Mayor](https://www.conversetx.net/government/city_council.php#faq-questions-58)

[Mayor Al Suarez](https://www.conversetx.net/government/city_council.php#collapse370b0)

![Suarez, Al - Mayor](https://www.conversetx.net/Images/City%20Services/City%20Secretary/Suarez,%20Al%20-%20Mayor.jpg?t=202508270954420)

Contact:
Email: mayor@conversetx.gov

Mayor Al Suarez was born in San Antonio, Texas, and is a graduate of Brackenridge High School, San Antonio, Texas. He served in the United States Air Force for 21 years as an Air Traffic Controller & Security Police Specialist. He participated in Operation Desert Shield & Desert Storm and was awarded the Air Force Meritorious Service Medal for Outstanding Military Service. He served 23 years with the Bexar County Criminal District & County Courts Adult Probation Department. He holds a Master of Arts degree in Criminal Justice Management & Administration, a Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice & Corrections, a Bachelor of Arts degree in Psychology & Behavioral Management, an Associate's degree in Security Administration, and an Associate’s degree in Airway Science. He is an Honor Graduate of the Air Traffic Control Specialist Program and a graduate of the Air Force Security Police Academy. He was elected to the Converse City Council Place 1 in May 2006 and Mayor of Converse in May 2007. He was re-elected to a 10th term as Converse Mayor in November 2025. He is the current Chairman of the Greater Bexar County Council of Cities (a 28-city Mayor organization). He was appointed to the Board of Directors for the Alamo Area Council of Governments (a 13-county organization). He is the former chairman of Northeast Partnership for Economic Development, a former President of the Judson Education Foundation, a former Vice President of San Antonio Orthopedic Foundation, and a former board member for the Canyon Regional Water Authority Board of Trustees. He is a member of the American Legion Post 593, VFW Post 8541, Alamo Honor Flight Guardian, JBSA Randolph Honorary Commander, and St. Monica Catholic Church.

![Mayors Call](https://www.conversetx.net/Images/City%20Services/City%20Secretary/Mayors%20Call.jpg?t=202508270956580)

Council Place 1

[Councilwoman Stephanie Gonzalez](https://www.conversetx.net/government/city_council.php#collapse371b0)

![Gonzalez, Stephanie - Place 1](https://www.conversetx.net/Images/City%20Services/City%20Secretary/Gonzalez,%20Stephanie%20-%20Place%201.jpg?t=202508271003480)

Contact:
Email: council1@conversetx.gov

Councilwoman Stephanie Michelle Gonzalez is honored to serve the residents of Converse City. A mother of five—two through marriage and one through adoption—and a proud grandmother of six, she is deeply rooted in the Judson community and committed to representing the city’s diverse population. Coming from a family of civil servants, she brings a lifelong dedication to public service.

Since joining the City Council, Councilwoman Gonzalez has served as the liaison to both the Planning & Zoning Commission and the Building & Standards Commission. She also represents Converse on the Board of Trustees for the Canyon Regional Water Authority, where she advocates for responsible regional water planning and long-term sustainability.

Councilwoman Gonzalez earned her associate’s degree from Lakeland College in 2010, graduating with a 3.5 GPA. Her career began in law enforcement, where she served as a police officer and worked on the Indiana Governor’s detail at the residence of Frank and Judy O’Bannon. She later continued her public-service-oriented career through roles in loss prevention and as a paralegal for a tort attorney in Cleveland, Ohio.

In her free time, she enjoys reading, acrylic painting, and spending time with her dogs, Pixie, Jinx, Loki, and Sugar. Councilwoman Gonzalez is proud to represent Converse City and remains dedicated to serving the community with integrity, compassion, and strong leadership.

It is an honor to serve the city that my family and I proudly call home. My husband and I have been together for 20 years, and we are the proud parents of three wonderful children. I am deeply committed to the future of our community, driven by a strong passion for fostering a thriving environment where families, including our own, can continue to grow and flourish. As a member of the City Council, my mission is to support thoughtful, sustainable growth that benefits all residents, ensuring a vibrant and welcoming future for our children and families in Converse.

Council Place 5

[Councilman Stacey L. Adams, Sr.](https://www.conversetx.net/government/city_council.php#collapse375b0)

![Adams Sr., Stacey L. - Place 5](https://www.conversetx.net/Images/City%20Services/City%20Secretary/Adams%20Sr.,%20Stacey%20L.%20-%20Place%205.jpg?t=202508271014530)
Contact:
Email: council5@conversetx.gov

Stacey L. Adams Sr. is a dedicated leader, entrepreneur, and community advocate. A graduate of the University of New Mexico, he is a faithful member of the Northside church of Christ. He is the proud father of three sons, Shelby Adams IV, Stacey Adams II, and Austin De La Rosa. Currently serving as City Councilman for Converse, Texas, Stacey has made a lasting impact on his community.
He is the founder of Limitless: Building Successful Youth and Adult Motivational Workshops, an organization established in 2003 that hosts motivational workshops for youth and adults. Stacey also owns the San Antonio Dream Team, where he has mentored numerous high school basketball players, helping them secure scholarships to D1, D2, and NAIA programs.
Beyond his business endeavors, Stacey has been a driving force in his community. He has served as President of the Judson High School Booster Club since 2015 and remains passionate about supporting Judson High. Additionally, he is the Senior Director of Community Relations for the Bryce Strong Foundation and the Senior Director of Transitional Care for Eduro, a role he has held since 2014.
Stacey’s commitment to his community and youth empowerment is unwavering, and he continues to shape the future through his leadership and mentorship.
